result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristina M Farina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 8/15/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 12 days jail for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kristina M Farina in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend charge to misdemeanor, however does not have an information to file today.  Court will take plea but orders state to file amended information by end of day on July 15, 2016.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to amended charge as a misdemeanor.  Court performs colloquy with Defendant and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 as a misdemeanor.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Menden makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $389.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 8/15/16, alternate 12 days jail if not paid) 

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
Received July 1, 2016,   State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Kristina M Farina did not appear.   Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment so Defendant can complete community service. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
(Fax) Dated today, from Atty Menden to Judge Carter, requesting that the Defendant be excused from 05/05/16 hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kristina M Farina in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjourned date in 60 days so Defendant can complete community service.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
